learning.supervised.evaluation

Interface ValidateableInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdaBoostM2, AKNN, ANHBNN, BoostableClassifier, CBWkNN, Classifier, DCT_ID3, DiscreteClassifier, DNaiveBayes, DOneRule, DWeightedNaiveBayes, DWHFNN, DWHFNNBoostable, DWKNN, DZeroRule, FNN, HFNN, HFNNBoostable, HIKNN, HIKNNBoostable, HIKNNNonDW, HwKNN, HwKNNBoostable, KNN, KNNNB, LWNB, NHBNN, NWKNN, PKNN, RRKNN, RSLVQ

    public interface ValidateableInterface
    This interface declares the methods needed for successful classifier evaluation, for both continuous and discretized data classifiers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ValidateableInterface copyConfiguration()
      This method copies the initial classifier configuration, without copying the entire trained model.

      void train()
      This method trains the classification model, based on the provided training data and parameters.
      void trainOnReducedData(InstanceSelector reducer)
      This method trains the classification model on the reduced dataset, based on the reduced training data and the additional information contained in the InstanceSelector object.

    • Method Detail

      • getParameterNamesAndDescriptions

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getParameterNamesAndDescriptions()
        Returns:
        HashMap that maps the parameters used in the algorithm to their descriptions.

      • getVersion

        long getVersion()
        Returns:
        Long value that is the current version of the implementation.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        String that is the classifier name.

      • setClasses

        void setClasses(java.lang.Object[] dataClasses)
        Parameters:
        dataClasses - Array of categories to set as the training data. It can correspond to continuous or discretized categories.

      • setData

        void setData(java.util.ArrayList data,
           java.lang.Object dataType)
        This method sets the training data array to the classifier.
        Parameters:
        data - ArrayList of data points.
        dataType - Object that is the data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.

      • setDataIndexes

        void setDataIndexes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> currentIndexes,
                  java.lang.Object dataType)
        This method sets the training data by indexes pointing to the data context.
        Parameters:
        currentIndexes - ArrayList of training data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier.
        Parameters:
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int[] testLabelArray,
                           int numClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier.
        Parameters:
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        testLabelArray - int[] representing the separate test data label array.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses,
                           float[][] trainingToTestDistances)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier.
        Parameters:
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        trainingToTestDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(float[] correctPointClassificationCounter,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Parameters:
        correctPointClassificationCounter - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(float[] correctPointClassificationCounter,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int[] testLabelArray,
                           int numClasses,
                           float[][] trainingToTestDistances)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Parameters:
        correctPointClassificationCounter - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        testLabelArray - int[] representing the separate test data label array.

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int[] testLabelArray,
                           int numClasses,
                           float[][] trainingToTestDistances,
                           int[][] pointNeighbors)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier.
        Parameters:
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        testLabelArray - int[] representing the separate test data label array.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        trainingToTestDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        pointNeighbors - int[][] representing and array of arrays of k-nearest neighbor indexes for the test data points among the training data, for kNN-based classification methods.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        trainingToTestDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        pointNeighbors - int[][] representing and array of arrays of k-nearest neighbor indexes for the test data points among the training data, for kNN-based classification methods.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.

        java.lang.Exception

      • copyConfiguration

        ValidateableInterface copyConfiguration()
        This method copies the initial classifier configuration, without copying the entire trained model. It essentially copies the parametrized classifier type.
        Returns:
        ValidateableInterface that is the copy of the parametrized initial classifier configuration.

      • train

        void train()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method trains the classification model, based on the provided training data and parameters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • trainOnReducedData

        void trainOnReducedData(InstanceSelector reducer)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        This method trains the classification model on the reduced dataset, based on the reduced training data and the additional information contained in the InstanceSelector object.
        Parameters:
        reducer - InstanceSelector object containing the additional data reduction - related information, including the unbiased neighbor occurrence frequency estimates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationCounter,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Parameters:
        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationCounter - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationCounter,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int[] testLabelArray,
                           int numClasses)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Parameters:
        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationCounter - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        testLabelArray - int[] representing the separate test data label array.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationCounter,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int numClasses,

        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationCounter - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        trainingToTestDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.

      • test

        ClassificationEstimator test(float[][] predictedProbLabelsAllData,
                           float[] correctPointClassificationCounter,
                           java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> indexes,
                           java.lang.Object dataType,
                           int[] testLabelArray,
                           int numClasses,
                           float[][] trainingToTestDistances,
                           int[][] pointNeighbors)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This method tests and evaluates the classifier, while keeping track of correct classifications for each class.
        Parameters:
        predictedProbLabelsAllData - float[][] representing the current predicted fuzzy labels for all data points (not only the test points in the current iteration, but rather all points from the original data.)
        correctPointClassificationCounter - float[] representing the counter of correct class-specific classifications, for latter analysis.
        indexes - ArrayList of test data indexes.
        dataType - Object that is the test data context. It can correspond to dense and sparse DataSet objects, as well as a DiscretizedDataSet data context.
        testLabelArray - int[] representing the separate test data label array.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        trainingToTestDistances - float[][] representing a matrix of distances from the training points to the test points.
        pointNeighbors - int[][] representing and array of arrays of k-nearest neighbor indexes for the test data points among the training data, for kNN-based classification methods.
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator containing the resulting classification quality measures.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
